hero.subtitle: Physics-based performance modeling for ultra-endurance athletes. Calibrated to your unique physiology.

features.title: Precision Engineering for Trail Running
features.subtitle: Most calculators just use average pace. We model the physics of every step.

biometric.title: Biometric Calibration
biometric.desc: We analyze your Strava history to extract your unique power-duration curve. The model knows exactly when you fade.

terrain.title: Terrain Physics
terrain.desc: A 15% grade on technical rock is slower than 15% on fire road. We account for surface efficiency and technicality.

pacing.title: Realistic Pacing
pacing.desc: Get a segment-by-segment plan. Know exactly where you should be at hour 10, not just hour 1.

disclaimer.title: Not a Crystal Ball.
disclaimer.text: This is a planning instrument. The output assumes optimal execution and conditions. Weather, nutrition failures, and injury are variables you must manage on race day. We provide the strategy; you provide the execution.

upload_card.title: Upload Route
upload_card.browse_text: or click to browse your filesystem

step1.title: Upload Route
step1.desc: Upload any standard GPX file. We analyze elevation, gradient, and distance.

step2.title: Physics Simulation
step2.desc: We apply your calibrated parameters (from Strava) to the route's specific terrain profile.

step3.title: Execution Plan
step3.desc: Get a detailed segment-by-segment pacing strategy and estimated finish time.

auth_required.title: Authentication Required
auth_required.text: To generate personalized predictions, we need to access your Strava history.

auth_error.title: Authentication Failed
auth_error.no_code: No authorization code was received from Strava.
auth_error.exchange_failed: Failed to exchange authorization code for access token.

auth_success.title: Authentication Successful!
auth_success.subtitle: You are connected to Strava. We are building your prediction model now.
auth_success.note: This can take a few minutes depending on your activity history.
auth_success.failed: Sync failed. You can still continue, but predictions may be limited.

results.title: Predicted Time
results.click_to_add: Click on the elevation profile below to add aid stations or markers.

prediction.title: Route Time Prediction
prediction.subtitle: Predict your time for

loading.title: Generating prediction...
loading.subtitle: Analyzing route segments with the trained model
loading.wait: This may take 5-30 seconds depending on route complexity

prediction.empty: No prediction yet. Click retry to start.

descriptions.TIER_1_PHYSICS: Physics model with default parameters (based on {count} activities)
descriptions.TIER_2_PARAMETER_LEARNING: Physics model with personalized parameters learned from your {count} activities
descriptions.TIER_3_RESIDUAL_ML: Physics model with ML corrections trained on your {count} activities

app.copyright: ¬© 2026 GPX Analyzer. Built for the mountains.

privacy.title: Privacy and Data
privacy.body1: GPX Analyzer uses your Strava data only to build your performance model and improve prediction accuracy. I do not sell or share your personal data with third parties.
privacy.body2: You can disconnect Strava at any time. If you request data removal, I will delete your stored profile and simulations.
privacy.body3: This product is in beta. If you have questions about data handling, contact me and I will reply directly.
privacy.contact_link: Contact me from the Who I am page

howitworks.title: How GPX Analyzer Works
howitworks.subtitle: A physics-first model, refined with your data to reflect how you really run on trails.

physics.title: Physics model
physics.text: We simulate effort over the route using elevation, gradient, distance, and terrain assumptions. This gives a baseline that respects the mechanics of climbing, descending, and fatigue.

ml.title: ML corrections
ml.text: Your Strava history is used to calibrate the model and correct it where your real-world performance differs from the baseline.

output.title: Practical race plan
output.text: The result is a segment-by-segment pacing strategy and finish-time estimate you can actually execute on race day.

about.title: Edoardo Gabrielli
about.subtitle: Trail runner, physics and software developer.
about.body1: I'm an amateur trail runner and a software developer with a physics background. In this project I apply modeling and data analysis to turn GPX tracks into actionable race-planning guidance.
about.body2: I developed GPX Analyzer to solve the gaps I felt in race planning, and now I share it with the community.
about.personal_title: Built from my own training, refined for yours.
about.personal_text: It began as a personal tool for long mountain days, then evolved into something other athletes could use with the same honesty and precision.
